subject: Re: [junit] fake console class
msgSnippet: Refactor your app so it doesn t depend directly on java.io.Console, but instead depends on your own interface with similar methods, for example foo.bar.IO.
messageBody:
Refactor your app so it doesn't depend directly on java.io.Console, but
instead depends on your own interface with similar methods, for example
foo.bar.IO. Pass an instance of IO via a constructor or setter (DI) and
supply a mock instance for testing and a Console-backed one in production.

Aslak

On Monday, September 24, 2012, Raji wrote:

> **
>
>
> How can I create a fake Console class to simulate user input for JUNIT
> testing? pl help
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
